result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mary Dianne Grant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mary Dianne Grant appeared by video.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Mary Dianne Grant.  Prosecuting Attorney Michael  in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting the Justice Point level be lowered as the defendant has a new job.  Court removed defendant from Justice Point monitoring.
Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 12-9-22 at 8:30  for final pretrial and 1-17-23 at 8:30 am  for jury trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mary Dianne Grant appeared by video.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Mary Dianne Grant.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defense counsel advises that there may be a possible global resolution. Court sets next court date for a Status Conference. Case adjourned to Br 10.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mary Dianne Grant in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials, but requests additional time to review with client. Case adjourned to Br 10.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-15-2022

Court ordered no contact with L.B.
No Contact Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Mary Dianne Grant in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Julie Ann Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Mary Dianne Grant not in court.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-30-2022 @2:30p
